markdownRemark.html: Becoming a new mom meant I wanted to experience all the things I associated with motherhood. That meant I HAD to have a traditional crib, even though a) we don’t have much space and b) we considered the possibility of bed-sharing before the baby came along. For those of us unfamiliar with the term, bed-sharing is the practice of having your baby sleep in the same bed as you. (Note: The AAP doesn’t recommend bed-sharing. We did our own research, however, and felt confident that bed-sharing was the right decision for us.) Sure enough, our little baby rarely used the crib. Four months in, we were fully committed to bed-sharing. We were ready for a floorplan update.⠀ ⠀ Because of an awkward column in the corner of our alcove, we couldn’t fit a normal king-size bed in our apartment. But we really needed a king to make bed-sharing more comfortable for us. We resorted to creating a CUSTOM king-size bed. Cue IKEA hack Materials: One LACK coffee table, one LACK side table, and a mini crib mattress from Amazon. We switched our sleeping orientation, and suddenly we had MORE than enough space for the three of us. Sweet dreams from our studio to yours!
